abstract: Both Microsoft and Google are essentially one-trick ponies that have used their prodigious cash flows to pursue side projects. The economic climate is reining in these efforts.
snippet: Both Microsoft and Google are essentially one-trick ponies that have used their prodigious cash flows to pursue side projects. The economic climate is reining in these efforts.

byline.original: By Jeff Segal and Martin Hutchinson

abstract: Google and Microsoft have begun reining in their sideline investments, and Breakingviews suggests that their other noncore projects should be next.
snippet: Google and Microsoft have begun reining in their sideline investments, and Breakingviews suggests that their other noncore projects should be next.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft and Google have more in common than the dominance of their respective markets, says Breakingviews.

headline.main: Yard Sales for Google and Microsoft?

abstract: Microsoft’s chief executive says the company still covets Yahoo’s search business.
snippet: Microsoft’s chief executive says the company still covets Yahoo’s search business.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft’s decision to lay off 5,000 workers in light of dismal financial results has not changed one thing at the software giant: Steven A. Ballmer, the chief executive, would still like to get his hands on Yahoo’s search business. And whether he succeeds or not, he plans to continue investing in Internet search to take on Google.

headline.main: Ballmer: Still Interested in Yahoo’s Search Business

abstract: Strong sales and cost-cutting pushed the company’s profitability above Wall Street’s recently lowered forecasts.
snippet: Strong sales and cost-cutting pushed the company’s profitability above Wall Street’s recently lowered forecasts.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google’s search advertising business continues to show resilience in the face of the deepening global recession.

headline.main: Google Beats Forecast Even as Its Profit Tapers
headline.print_headline: Google Beats Forecast Even as Its Profit Tapers
